name: Letter from Lipsius, Justus to Clusius, Carolus, 1590-03-15

Diplomatic.text: I[ustus] Lipsius Carolo Clusio S[alutem] D[icit]. Litteras tuas nuper accepimus, mi Clusi, et in iis inclusum nummum veterem in Dacia repertum, certe rarum et cum cura a me asservandum. Quod Politica nostra ad illos miseris quibus inscripseram, gratiam tibi debeo. Sed quid audio? Illicne recusa? Ita hodie audivimus et nollem cum Plantinianorum caussa, tum etiam quia in primis illis exemplaribus ita subito missis aliquot errata, quae in aliis deinde correcta. Sed tamen errata talia, quae facile viderit peritior lector. Hortus tuus quo loco? Meus hoc gelu sensit, sive nives et XX circiter tulipas amisi, utinam non e selectis. Tu, si abundas (vide os meum), quaeso, mitte aliquot bulbos rarioris generis aut coloris. Mirifice capior; in tot taediis temporum grande hoc mihi levamentum. Velim de valetudine tua scire atque item de consilio mansionis. Nam postremis tuis ambigere videbaris utrumne Francofurti porro haereres. Utinam in loco aliquo nostro aut viciniore nobis! Sed hoc pro tua prudentia. Nec ego quidem nimis hic firmus et valetudinis caussa agito interdum de aere mutando. Classis Iberica iterum instruitur in Iberniam ut plerique volunt, ut alii in Galliam. Mi Clusi, adeo non finiunt isti motus ut nunc demum videantur exoriri. Aliud quod hinc nunciem nihil est, nisi Bredam esse captam, ut olim Troiam, ligneo equo, id est navi. Nos Epistolarum alteram Centuriam edimus et paramus tres Dialogos de institutione iuventutis, sic tamen, si Deus et valetudo favebunt. Vale, V[ir] C[larissime]. Lugd[uni] Bat[avorum], Idibus Mart[iis] MD.LXXXX. [Address:] Cl[arissi]mo et doctiss[im]o Viro, D[omino] Carolo Clusio. Francofurtum. [altera manu:] Ses dhalve gulden min een halve stuver.

annotations.text: errata ... correcta: Lipsius had asked Clusius to correct a few tiny mistakes in the copies he had sent him, as had been done in the supply in Leiden, cf. ILE [c. 89 08 20] LE.
Politica ... miseris: Lipsius had asked Clusius to forward copies of his Politica to Emperor Rudolph II, Count Palatine Frederic IV, and Landgrave Maurice of Hessen, cf. ILE III, 89 08 10.
nummum: Clusius had sent him a silver coin with his previous letter, cf. ILE III, 89 10 05.

mansionis: In that same letter he had complained that life was much more expensive in Frankfurt than in Vienna; to boot, the citizens were not very friendly towards foreigners. Nevertheless, Clusius remained in Frankfurt until 1593, when he accepted an invitation by Leiden university to lay out a hortus botanicus.
Dialogos ... iuventutis: Lipsius had already mentioned this plan in 1585 and 1586, but the project was shelved, although correspondents kapt asking for it.
recusa: The Frankfurt printer Johann Wechel had managed to have a reprint of the Politica, based on Raphelengius’s edition of 1589, available at the spring book fair of 1590.

Plantinianorum caussa: It is the first time that Lipsius is confronted with a non-authorized publication of one of his works. Before, they had always been protected by the privileges granted to Christopher Plantin by Emperor Maximilian II and King Henry III of France, but now that Plantin was dead († 1 July 1589) whoever wanted to publish these works could do so. In 1592 Lipsius decided to submit a request to the Emperor to grant him a privilege.
Bredam: Breda was captured by Prince Maurice of Nassau in February 1590.
valetudine: In a post script, Clusius had informed Lipsius that he was suffering a heavy cold.
Classis Iberica: In 1590 rumours were circulating about a new Spanish fleer, but there were no indications that it was already being constructed.
Epistolarum ... Centuriam: Epistolarum centuriae duae. Quarum prior innovata, altera nova (Leiden: F. Raphelengius, 1590), already announced in ILE III, 89 08 10.

metadata.value: Answer to ILE III, 89 10 05. There is also a copy of this letter in ms. Vulc. 101 (L), made by Petrus Burmannus, although he did not publish the letter in his Sylloge.
Hugo Peeters, recog. Jeanine De Landtsheer
